alert.note: Alert for Carlisle; Fulton; Graves; Hickman (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:49AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fulton, western Carlisle, Hickman, southern Graves, southeastern Mississippi, New Madrid and southeastern Stoddard Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 548 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bardwell to near East Prairie to near Canalou. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bardwell, Big Oak Tree State Park and Towosahgy State Historic Site around 555 AM CDT. Dorena around 600 AM CDT. Hickman and Clinton around 605 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fulgham and Cayce. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 17. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 33 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
